metadata.title: CVE-2012-2402 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
wp-admin/plugins.php in WordPress before 3.3.2 allows remote authenticatedsite administrators to bypass intended access restrictions and deactivatenetwork-wide plugins via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2402` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.3.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.3.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.2+dfsg-1').
